content.description: The carbohydrates glucose, galactose, and fructose have the same chemical formula <math alttext="C 6 H 12 O 6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>6</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> but different structural formulas, as represented in the figure.
content.question: Which of the following statements about glucose, galactose, and fructose is most likely true?

choices.label: The carbohydrates have the same properties because they have the same number of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen atoms.
The carbohydrates have the same properties because they each have a single carbon-oxygen double bond.
The carbohydrates have different properties because they have different arrangements of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen atoms.
The carbohydrates have different properties because they have different numbers of carbon-carbon bonds.

content.answer: The carbohydrates have different properties because they have different arrangements of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen atoms.

topic.text: 1.1: Structure of Water and Hydrogen Bonding

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
